millsfield:images_texts:
March
Nineteenth,
1 9 2 7.
Market Street Railway Co.,
58 Sutter St..
San Francisco.
Gentlemen;
The City and County of San Prancisco has leased from
the Mills Betate a tract of land on the Bay Shore, opposite
Lonita Park, in San Mateo County, to be used as an air port,
The lease runs for three years with an option for renewal
for two additional years.
There is also a possibility that
this site will be selected as a permanent air port site.
Te have made arrangements with the City of San Bruno for
a fresh water supply, and it will be necessary in order to make
a connection with their water system to cross beneath the tracks
of your railroad near Iomita Park station.
I
am forwarding
herewith a blue print showing the location of the said water
pipe.
We would like to seoure from your Company the right or
privilege to maintain this water pipe in the location as shown
on the accompanying plan.
agreement covering a
I do not know if you have any form of
transaction of this kind, but 11 you have
I an sure it would be satisfactory to us.
We are anious to have the air port ready by the 5th of
May, as there will be a convention of air men in San Francisco
that time, and I would appreciate your early consideration
in this matter.
Very truly yours,
RIGHT OF WAY AGENT.
JJP: KI
375 City Hall.
010.545 813.00s
properties.sfomuseum:airport: Mills Field Municipal Airport of San Francisco
properties.sfomuseum:description: Facsimile of correspondence from Joseph J. Phillips, Right of Way Agent for City and County of San Francisco, to Market Street Railway Company, dated March 19, 1927, concerning request to install water pipeline in conjunction with lease of Mills Estate property in San Mateo County for use as airport; file copy, not signed or mailed.
properties.wof:name: correspondence: Joseph J. Phillips, Right of Way Agent for City and County of San Francisco
